plain_warning: Clinical Insights: Concurrent use may increase metabolic burden on the kidneys. Regular monitoring of kidney function is recommended.
Clinical Insights: Concurreny use may impact kidney function and lactic acid levels. Adequate hydration is essential.
Clinical Insights: Generally safe, but may slightly enhance blood sugar lowering effects. Monitoring blood glucose is advisable when satrting.

plain_meaning: Management Tip: Your blood glucose level is within the ideal control range of 6.0 to 8.0 mmol/L. Please confirm with your doctor whether you have reached your personal target.
Management Notice (High): Your blood glucose level is above the target range of 8.001 mmol/L. Adjustments to your diet or medication may be necessary. Please contact your doctor for evaluation.
Management Tip (Low): Your blood glucose level is below the target range of 6.0 mmol/L. Please be aware of the risk of hypoglycemia and consult your doctor as soon as possible.
The results indicate that serum creatinine levels are in the high range (104 to 200 μmol/L). Kidney function may be slightly impaired; further consultation with a doctor is recommended.

plain_relevance: Medical fact: Long-term high blood pressure can directly damage the kidney's filtering organs and is one of the main causes of chronic kidney disease.
Medical fact: High blood sugar can continuously damage the blood vessels in the kidneys and is one of the most common causes of chronic kidney disease.
